---
title: "Graphical representation of association rules"
output:
  html_document:
    df_print: paged
---

As for other analyses, visualization is an important tool when examining association rules. The arulesViz package provides visualization tools for association rules.

```{r}
library(arules)
library(arulesViz)
library(vcdExtra)
data(ICU)

ICU_tr = as(ICU[-4], "transactions")

rulesDeath2 <- apriori(ICU_tr,
 parameter = list(support=0.01, confidence = 0.3, minlen=3, maxlen=3),
 appearance = list(rhs = c("died=Yes"), default="lhs"))
inspect(rulesDeath2)

plot(rulesDeath2,method="graph")
plot(rulesDeath2,method="graph", interactive=TRUE)
```

or rules for Coma

```{r}
rulesComa<- apriori(ICU_tr,
 parameter = list(support=0.01, confidence = 0.95,maxlen=3),
 appearance = list(rhs = c("coma=Coma"), default="lhs")) 
summary(rulesComa)
inspect(rulesComa)

plot(rulesComa,method="graph")
plot(rulesComa,method="graph", interactive=TRUE)
```
